61  /**
62   * <p>Used to communicate with a single HBase table.
63   *
64   * <p>This class is not thread safe for reads nor write.
65   * 
66   * <p>In case of writes (Put, Delete), the underlying write buffer can
67   * be corrupted if multiple threads contend over a single HTable instance.
68   * 
69   * <p>In case of reads, some fields used by a Scan are shared among all threads.
70   * The HTable implementation can either not contract to be safe in case of a Get
71   *
72   * <p>To access a table in a multi threaded environment, please consider
73   * using the {@link HTablePool} class to create your HTable instances.
74   *
75   * <p>Instances of HTable passed the same {@link Configuration} instance will
76   * share connections to servers out on the cluster and to the zookeeper ensemble
77   * as well as caches of region locations.  This is usually a *good* thing and it
78   * is recommended to reuse the same configuration object for all your tables.
79   * This happens because they will all share the same underlying
80   * {@link HConnection} instance. See {@link HConnectionManager} for more on
81   * how this mechanism works.
82   *
83   * <p>{@link HConnection} will read most of the
84   * configuration it needs from the passed {@link Configuration} on initial
85   * construction.  Thereafter, for settings such as
86   * <code>hbase.client.pause</code>, <code>hbase.client.retries.number</code>,
87   * and <code>hbase.client.rpc.maxattempts</code> updating their values in the
88   * passed {@link Configuration} subsequent to {@link HConnection} construction
89   * will go unnoticed.  To run with changed values, make a new
90   * {@link HTable} passing a new {@link Configuration} instance that has the
91   * new configuration.
92   *
93   * <p>Note that this class implements the {@link Closeable} interface. When a
94   * HTable instance is no longer required, it *should* be closed in order to ensure
95   * that the underlying resources are promptly released. Please note that the close 
96   * method can throw java.io.IOException that must be handled.
97   *
98   * @see HBaseAdmin for create, drop, list, enable and disable of tables.
99   * @see HConnection
100  * @see HConnectionManager
101  */
102 public class HTable implements HTableInterface {
103   private static final Log LOG = LogFactory.getLog(HTable.class);
104   private HConnection connection;
105   private final byte [] tableName;
106   private volatile Configuration configuration;
107   private final ArrayList<Put> writeBuffer = new ArrayList<Put>();
108   private long writeBufferSize;
109   private boolean clearBufferOnFail;
110   private boolean autoFlush;
111   private long currentWriteBufferSize;
112   protected int scannerCaching;
113   private int maxKeyValueSize;
114   private ExecutorService pool;  // For Multi
115   private boolean closed;
116   private int operationTimeout;
117   private static final int DOPUT_WB_CHECK = 10;    // i.e., doPut checks the writebuffer every X Puts.
118   private final boolean cleanupPoolOnClose; // shutdown the pool in close()
119   private final boolean cleanupConnectionOnClose; // close the connection in close()
120 
121   /**
122    * Creates an object to access a HBase table.
123    * Internally it creates a new instance of {@link Configuration} and a new
124    * client to zookeeper as well as other resources.  It also comes up with
125    * a fresh view of the cluster and must do discovery from scratch of region
126    * locations; i.e. it will not make use of already-cached region locations if
127    * available. Use only when being quick and dirty.
128    * @throws IOException if a remote or network exception occurs
129    * @deprecated use {@link #HTable(Configuration, String)}
130    */
131   @Deprecated
132   public HTable(final String tableName)
133   throws IOException {
134     this(HBaseConfiguration.create(), Bytes.toBytes(tableName));
135     LOG.warn("This constructor HTable(byte[]) is deprecated and it will be removed. " +
136              "Please use HTable(Configuration, byte[]) to construct an HTable");
137   }
138 
139   /**
140    * Creates an object to access a HBase table.
141    * Internally it creates a new instance of {@link Configuration} and a new
142    * client to zookeeper as well as other resources.  It also comes up with
143    * a fresh view of the cluster and must do discovery from scratch of region
144    * locations; i.e. it will not make use of already-cached region locations if
145    * available. Use only when being quick and dirty.
146    * @param tableName Name of the table.
147    * @throws IOException if a remote or network exception occurs
148    * @deprecated use {@link #HTable(Configuration, byte[])}
149    */
150   @Deprecated
151   public HTable(final byte [] tableName)
152   throws IOException {
153     this(HBaseConfiguration.create(), tableName);
154     LOG.warn("This constructor HTable(byte[]) is deprecated and it will be removed. " +
155              "Please use HTable(Configuration, byte[]) to construct an HTable");
156   }
157 
158   /**
159    * Creates an object to access a HBase table.
160    * Shares zookeeper connection and other resources with other HTable instances
161    * created with the same <code>conf</code> instance.  Uses already-populated
162    * region cache if one is available, populated by any other HTable instances
163    * sharing this <code>conf</code> instance.  Recommended.
164    * @param conf Configuration object to use.
165    * @param tableName Name of the table.
166    * @throws IOException if a remote or network exception occurs
167    */
168   public HTable(Configuration conf, final String tableName)
169   throws IOException {
170     this(conf, Bytes.toBytes(tableName));
171   }
172 
173 
174   /**
175    * Creates an object to access a HBase table.
176    * Shares zookeeper connection and other resources with other HTable instances
177    * created with the same <code>conf</code> instance.  Uses already-populated
178    * region cache if one is available, populated by any other HTable instances
179    * sharing this <code>conf</code> instance.  Recommended.
180    * @param conf Configuration object to use.
181    * @param tableName Name of the table.
182    * @throws IOException if a remote or network exception occurs
183    */
184   public HTable(Configuration conf, final byte [] tableName)
185   throws IOException {
186     this.tableName = tableName;
187     this.cleanupPoolOnClose = this.cleanupConnectionOnClose = true;
188     if (conf == null) {
189       this.connection = null;
190       return;
191     }
192     this.connection = HConnectionManager.getConnection(conf);
193     this.configuration = conf;
194 
195     int maxThreads = conf.getInt("hbase.htable.threads.max", Integer.MAX_VALUE);
196     if (maxThreads == 0) {
197       maxThreads = 1; // is there a better default?
198     }
199     long keepAliveTime = conf.getLong("hbase.htable.threads.keepalivetime", 60);
200 
201     // Using the "direct handoff" approach, new threads will only be created
202     // if it is necessary and will grow unbounded. This could be bad but in HCM
203     // we only create as many Runnables as there are region servers. It means
204     // it also scales when new region servers are added.
205     this.pool = new ThreadPoolExecutor(1, maxThreads,
206         keepAliveTime, TimeUnit.SECONDS,
207         new SynchronousQueue<Runnable>(),
208         Threads.newDaemonThreadFactory("hbase-table"));
209     ((ThreadPoolExecutor)this.pool).allowCoreThreadTimeOut(true);
210 
211     this.finishSetup();
212   }
213 
214   /**
215    * Creates an object to access a HBase table.
216    * Shares zookeeper connection and other resources with other HTable instances
217    * created with the same <code>conf</code> instance.  Uses already-populated
218    * region cache if one is available, populated by any other HTable instances
219    * sharing this <code>conf</code> instance.
220    * Use this constructor when the ExecutorService is externally managed.
221    * @param conf Configuration object to use.
222    * @param tableName Name of the table.
223    * @param pool ExecutorService to be used.
224    * @throws IOException if a remote or network exception occurs
225    */
226   public HTable(Configuration conf, final byte[] tableName, final ExecutorService pool)
227       throws IOException {
228     this.connection = HConnectionManager.getConnection(conf);
229     this.configuration = conf;
230     this.pool = pool;
231     this.tableName = tableName;
232     this.cleanupPoolOnClose = false;
233     this.cleanupConnectionOnClose = true;
234 
235     this.finishSetup();
236   }
237 
238   /**
239    * Creates an object to access a HBase table.
240    * Shares zookeeper connection and other resources with other HTable instances
241    * created with the same <code>connection</code> instance.
242    * Use this constructor when the ExecutorService and HConnection instance are
243    * externally managed.
244    * @param tableName Name of the table.
245    * @param connection HConnection to be used.
246    * @param pool ExecutorService to be used.
247    * @throws IOException if a remote or network exception occurs
248    */
249   public HTable(final byte[] tableName, final HConnection connection, 
250       final ExecutorService pool) throws IOException {
251     if (pool == null || pool.isShutdown()) {
252       throw new IllegalArgumentException("Pool is null or shut down.");
253     }
254     if (connection == null || connection.isClosed()) {
255       throw new IllegalArgumentException("Connection is null or closed.");
256     }
257     this.tableName = tableName;
258     this.cleanupPoolOnClose = this.cleanupConnectionOnClose = false;
259     this.connection = connection;
260     this.configuration = connection.getConfiguration();
261     this.pool = pool;
262 
263     this.finishSetup();
264   }
265 
266   /**
267    * setup this HTable's parameter based on the passed configuration
268    * @param conf
269    */
270   private void finishSetup() throws IOException {
271     this.connection.locateRegion(tableName, HConstants.EMPTY_START_ROW);
272     this.operationTimeout = HTableDescriptor.isMetaTable(tableName) ? HConstants.DEFAULT_HBASE_CLIENT_OPERATION_TIMEOUT
273         : this.configuration.getInt(HConstants.HBASE_CLIENT_OPERATION_TIMEOUT,
274             HConstants.DEFAULT_HBASE_CLIENT_OPERATION_TIMEOUT);
275     this.writeBufferSize = this.configuration.getLong(
276         "hbase.client.write.buffer", 2097152);
277     this.clearBufferOnFail = true;
278     this.autoFlush = true;
279     this.currentWriteBufferSize = 0;
280     this.scannerCaching = this.configuration.getInt(
281         "hbase.client.scanner.caching", 1);
282 
283     this.maxKeyValueSize = this.configuration.getInt(
284         "hbase.client.keyvalue.maxsize", -1);
285     this.closed = false;
286   }
287 
288   /**
289    * {@inheritDoc}
290    */
291   @Override
292   public Configuration getConfiguration() {
293     return configuration;
294   }

296   /**
297    * Tells whether or not a table is enabled or not. This method creates a
298    * new HBase configuration, so it might make your unit tests fail due to
299    * incorrect ZK client port.
300    * @param tableName Name of table to check.
301    * @return {@code true} if table is online.
302    * @throws IOException if a remote or network exception occurs
303 	* @deprecated use {@link HBaseAdmin#isTableEnabled(byte[])}
304    */
305   @Deprecated
306   public static boolean isTableEnabled(String tableName) throws IOException {
307     return isTableEnabled(Bytes.toBytes(tableName));
308   }
309 
310   /**
311    * Tells whether or not a table is enabled or not. This method creates a
312    * new HBase configuration, so it might make your unit tests fail due to
313    * incorrect ZK client port.
314    * @param tableName Name of table to check.
315    * @return {@code true} if table is online.
316    * @throws IOException if a remote or network exception occurs
317    * @deprecated use {@link HBaseAdmin#isTableEnabled(byte[])}
318    */
319   @Deprecated
320   public static boolean isTableEnabled(byte[] tableName) throws IOException {
321     return isTableEnabled(HBaseConfiguration.create(), tableName);
322   }
323 
324   /**
325    * Tells whether or not a table is enabled or not.
326    * @param conf The Configuration object to use.
327    * @param tableName Name of table to check.
328    * @return {@code true} if table is online.
329    * @throws IOException if a remote or network exception occurs
330 	* @deprecated use {@link HBaseAdmin#isTableEnabled(byte[])}
331    */
332   @Deprecated
333   public static boolean isTableEnabled(Configuration conf, String tableName)
334   throws IOException {
335     return isTableEnabled(conf, Bytes.toBytes(tableName));
336   }
337 
338   /**
339    * Tells whether or not a table is enabled or not.
340    * @param conf The Configuration object to use.
341    * @param tableName Name of table to check.
342    * @return {@code true} if table is online.
343    * @throws IOException if a remote or network exception occurs
344    */
345   public static boolean isTableEnabled(Configuration conf,
346       final byte[] tableName) throws IOException {
347     return HConnectionManager.execute(new HConnectable<Boolean>(conf) {
348       @Override
349       public Boolean connect(HConnection connection) throws IOException {
350         return connection.isTableEnabled(tableName);
351       }
352     });
353   }

355   /**
356    * Find region location hosting passed row using cached info
357    * @param row Row to find.
358    * @return The location of the given row.
359    * @throws IOException if a remote or network exception occurs
360    */
361   public HRegionLocation getRegionLocation(final String row)
362   throws IOException {
363     return connection.getRegionLocation(tableName, Bytes.toBytes(row), false);
364   }
365 
366   /**
367    * Finds the region on which the given row is being served.
368    * @param row Row to find.
369    * @return Location of the row.
370    * @throws IOException if a remote or network exception occurs
371    * @deprecated use {@link #getRegionLocation(byte [], boolean)} instead
372    */
373   public HRegionLocation getRegionLocation(final byte [] row)
374   throws IOException {
375     return connection.getRegionLocation(tableName, row, false);
376   }
377 
378   /**
379    * Finds the region on which the given row is being served.
380    * @param row Row to find.
381    * @param reload whether or not to reload information or just use cached
382    * information
383    * @return Location of the row.
384    * @throws IOException if a remote or network exception occurs
385    */
386   public HRegionLocation getRegionLocation(final byte [] row, boolean reload)
387   throws IOException {
388     return connection.getRegionLocation(tableName, row, reload);
389   }

399   /**
400    * <em>INTERNAL</em> Used by unit tests and tools to do low-level
401    * manipulations.
402    * @return An HConnection instance.
403    * @deprecated This method will be changed from public to package protected.
404    */
405   // TODO(tsuna): Remove this.  Unit tests shouldn't require public helpers.
406   public HConnection getConnection() {
407     return this.connection;
408   }
409 
410   /**
411    * Gets the number of rows that a scanner will fetch at once.
412    * <p>
413    * The default value comes from {@code hbase.client.scanner.caching}.
414    * @deprecated Use {@link Scan#setCaching(int)} and {@link Scan#getCaching()}
415    */
416   public int getScannerCaching() {
417     return scannerCaching;
418   }
419 
420   /**
421    * Sets the number of rows that a scanner will fetch at once.
422    * <p>
423    * This will override the value specified by
424    * {@code hbase.client.scanner.caching}.
425    * Increasing this value will reduce the amount of work needed each time
426    * {@code next()} is called on a scanner, at the expense of memory use
427    * (since more rows will need to be maintained in memory by the scanners).
428    * @param scannerCaching the number of rows a scanner will fetch at once.
429    * @deprecated Use {@link Scan#setCaching(int)}
430    */
431   public void setScannerCaching(int scannerCaching) {
432     this.scannerCaching = scannerCaching;
433   }
434 
435   /**
436    * {@inheritDoc}
437    */
438   @Override
439   public HTableDescriptor getTableDescriptor() throws IOException {
440     return new UnmodifyableHTableDescriptor(
441       this.connection.getHTableDescriptor(this.tableName));
442   }
443 
444   /**
445    * Gets the starting row key for every region in the currently open table.
446    * <p>
447    * This is mainly useful for the MapReduce integration.
448    * @return Array of region starting row keys
449    * @throws IOException if a remote or network exception occurs
450    */
451   public byte [][] getStartKeys() throws IOException {
452     return getStartEndKeys().getFirst();
453   }
454 
455   /**
456    * Gets the ending row key for every region in the currently open table.
457    * <p>
458    * This is mainly useful for the MapReduce integration.
459    * @return Array of region ending row keys
460    * @throws IOException if a remote or network exception occurs
461    */
462   public byte[][] getEndKeys() throws IOException {
463     return getStartEndKeys().getSecond();
464   }
465 
466   /**
467    * Gets the starting and ending row keys for every region in the currently
468    * open table.
469    * <p>
470    * This is mainly useful for the MapReduce integration.
471    * @return Pair of arrays of region starting and ending row keys
472    * @throws IOException if a remote or network exception occurs
473    */
474   public Pair<byte[][],byte[][]> getStartEndKeys() throws IOException {
475     NavigableMap<HRegionInfo, ServerName> regions = getRegionLocations();
476     final List<byte[]> startKeyList = new ArrayList<byte[]>(regions.size());
477     final List<byte[]> endKeyList = new ArrayList<byte[]>(regions.size());
478 
479     for (HRegionInfo region : regions.keySet()) {
480       startKeyList.add(region.getStartKey());
481       endKeyList.add(region.getEndKey());
482     }
483 
484     return new Pair<byte [][], byte [][]>(
485       startKeyList.toArray(new byte[startKeyList.size()][]),
486       endKeyList.toArray(new byte[endKeyList.size()][]));
487   }
488 
489   /**
490    * Gets all the regions and their address for this table.
491    * @return A map of HRegionInfo with it's server address
492    * @throws IOException if a remote or network exception occurs
493    * @deprecated Use {@link #getRegionLocations()} or {@link #getStartEndKeys()}
494    */
495   public Map<HRegionInfo, HServerAddress> getRegionsInfo() throws IOException {
496     final Map<HRegionInfo, HServerAddress> regionMap =
497       new TreeMap<HRegionInfo, HServerAddress>();
498 
499     final Map<HRegionInfo, ServerName> regionLocations = getRegionLocations();
500 
501     for (Map.Entry<HRegionInfo, ServerName> entry : regionLocations.entrySet()) {
502       HServerAddress server = new HServerAddress();
503       ServerName serverName = entry.getValue();
504       if (serverName != null && serverName.getHostAndPort() != null) {
505         server = new HServerAddress(Addressing.createInetSocketAddressFromHostAndPortStr(
506             serverName.getHostAndPort()));
507       }
508       regionMap.put(entry.getKey(), server);
509     }
510 
511     return regionMap;
512   }
513 
514   /**
515    * Gets all the regions and their address for this table.
516    * <p>
517    * This is mainly useful for the MapReduce integration.
518    * @return A map of HRegionInfo with it's server address
519    * @throws IOException if a remote or network exception occurs
520    */
521   public NavigableMap<HRegionInfo, ServerName> getRegionLocations() throws IOException {
522     return MetaScanner.allTableRegions(getConfiguration(), getTableName(), false);
523   }
524 
525   /**
526    * Get the corresponding regions for an arbitrary range of keys.
527    * <p>
528    * @param startRow Starting row in range, inclusive
529    * @param endRow Ending row in range, exclusive
530    * @return A list of HRegionLocations corresponding to the regions that
531    * contain the specified range
532    * @throws IOException if a remote or network exception occurs
533    */
534   public List<HRegionLocation> getRegionsInRange(final byte [] startKey,
535     final byte [] endKey) throws IOException {
536     final boolean endKeyIsEndOfTable = Bytes.equals(endKey,
537                                                     HConstants.EMPTY_END_ROW);
538     if ((Bytes.compareTo(startKey, endKey) > 0) && !endKeyIsEndOfTable) {
539       throw new IllegalArgumentException(
540         "Invalid range: " + Bytes.toStringBinary(startKey) +
541         " > " + Bytes.toStringBinary(endKey));
542     }
543     final List<HRegionLocation> regionList = new ArrayList<HRegionLocation>();
544     byte [] currentKey = startKey;
545     do {
546       HRegionLocation regionLocation = getRegionLocation(currentKey, false);
547       regionList.add(regionLocation);
548       currentKey = regionLocation.getRegionInfo().getEndKey();
549     } while (!Bytes.equals(currentKey, HConstants.EMPTY_END_ROW) &&
550              (endKeyIsEndOfTable || Bytes.compareTo(currentKey, endKey) < 0));
551     return regionList;
552   }
553 
554   /**
555    * Save the passed region information and the table's regions
556    * cache.
557    * <p>
558    * This is mainly useful for the MapReduce integration. You can call
559    * {@link #deserializeRegionInfo deserializeRegionInfo}
560    * to deserialize regions information from a
561    * {@link DataInput}, then call this method to load them to cache.
562    *
563    * <pre>
564    * {@code
565    * HTable t1 = new HTable("foo");
566    * FileInputStream fis = new FileInputStream("regions.dat");
567    * DataInputStream dis = new DataInputStream(fis);
568    *
569    * Map<HRegionInfo, HServerAddress> hm = t1.deserializeRegionInfo(dis);
570    * t1.prewarmRegionCache(hm);
571    * }
572    * </pre>
573    * @param regionMap This piece of regions information will be loaded
574    * to region cache.
575    */
576   public void prewarmRegionCache(Map<HRegionInfo, HServerAddress> regionMap) {
577     this.connection.prewarmRegionCache(this.getTableName(), regionMap);
578   }
579 
580   /**
581    * Serialize the regions information of this table and output
582    * to <code>out</code>.
583    * <p>
584    * This is mainly useful for the MapReduce integration. A client could
585    * perform a large scan for all the regions for the table, serialize the
586    * region info to a file. MR job can ship a copy of the meta for the table in
587    * the DistributedCache.
588    * <pre>
589    * {@code
590    * FileOutputStream fos = new FileOutputStream("regions.dat");
591    * DataOutputStream dos = new DataOutputStream(fos);
592    * table.serializeRegionInfo(dos);
593    * dos.flush();
594    * dos.close();
595    * }
596    * </pre>
597    * @param out {@link DataOutput} to serialize this object into.
598    * @throws IOException if a remote or network exception occurs
599    */
600   public void serializeRegionInfo(DataOutput out) throws IOException {
601     Map<HRegionInfo, HServerAddress> allRegions = this.getRegionsInfo();
602     // first, write number of regions
603     out.writeInt(allRegions.size());
604     for (Map.Entry<HRegionInfo, HServerAddress> es : allRegions.entrySet()) {
605       es.getKey().write(out);
606       es.getValue().write(out);
607     }
608   }
609 
610   /**
611    * Read from <code>in</code> and deserialize the regions information.
612    *
613    * <p>It behaves similarly as {@link #getRegionsInfo getRegionsInfo}, except
614    * that it loads the region map from a {@link DataInput} object.
615    *
616    * <p>It is supposed to be followed immediately by  {@link
617    * #prewarmRegionCache prewarmRegionCache}.
618    *
619    * <p>
620    * Please refer to {@link #prewarmRegionCache prewarmRegionCache} for usage.
621    *
622    * @param in {@link DataInput} object.
623    * @return A map of HRegionInfo with its server address.
624    * @throws IOException if an I/O exception occurs.
625    */
626   public Map<HRegionInfo, HServerAddress> deserializeRegionInfo(DataInput in)
627   throws IOException {
628     final Map<HRegionInfo, HServerAddress> allRegions =
629       new TreeMap<HRegionInfo, HServerAddress>();
630 
631     // the first integer is expected to be the size of records
632     int regionsCount = in.readInt();
633     for (int i = 0; i < regionsCount; ++i) {
634       HRegionInfo hri = new HRegionInfo();
635       hri.readFields(in);
636       HServerAddress hsa = new HServerAddress();
637       hsa.readFields(in);
638       allRegions.put(hri, hsa);
639     }
640     return allRegions;
641   }
642 
643   /**
644    * {@inheritDoc}
645    */
646    @Override
647    public Result getRowOrBefore(final byte[] row, final byte[] family)
648    throws IOException {
649      return new ServerCallable<Result>(connection, tableName, row, operationTimeout) {
650        public Result call() throws IOException {
651          return server.getClosestRowBefore(location.getRegionInfo().getRegionName(),
652            row, family);
653        }
654      }.withRetries();
655    }

663       scan.setCaching(getScannerCaching());
664     }
665     return new ClientScanner(getConfiguration(), scan, getTableName(),
666         this.connection);
667   }

701 
702   /**
703    * {@inheritDoc}
704    */
705   @Override
706   public Result[] get(List<Get> gets) throws IOException {
707     try {
708       Object [] r1 = batch((List)gets);
709 
710       // translate.
711       Result [] results = new Result[r1.length];
712       int i=0;
713       for (Object o : r1) {
714         // batch ensures if there is a failure we get an exception instead
715         results[i++] = (Result) o;
716       }
717 
718       return results;
719     } catch (InterruptedException e) {
720       throw new IOException(e);
721     }
722   }
723 
724   /**
725    * {@inheritDoc}
726    */
727   @Override
728   public void batch(final List<?extends Row> actions, final Object[] results)
729       throws InterruptedException, IOException {
730     connection.processBatch(actions, tableName, pool, results);
731   }
732 
733   /**
734    * {@inheritDoc}
735    */
736   @Override
737   public Object[] batch(final List<? extends Row> actions) throws InterruptedException, IOException {
738     Object[] results = new Object[actions.size()];
739     connection.processBatch(actions, tableName, pool, results);
740     return results;
741   }

744    * {@inheritDoc}
745    */
746   @Override
747   public void delete(final Delete delete)
748   throws IOException {
749     new ServerCallable<Boolean>(connection, tableName, delete.getRow(), operationTimeout) {
750           public Boolean call() throws IOException {
751             server.delete(location.getRegionInfo().getRegionName(), delete);
752             return null; // FindBugs NP_BOOLEAN_RETURN_NULL
753           }
754         }.withRetries();
755   }
756 
757   /**
758    * {@inheritDoc}
759    */
760   @Override
761   public void delete(final List<Delete> deletes)
762   throws IOException {
763     Object[] results = new Object[deletes.size()];
764     try {
765       connection.processBatch((List) deletes, tableName, pool, results);
766     } catch (InterruptedException e) {
767       throw new IOException(e);
768     } finally {
769       // mutate list so that it is empty for complete success, or contains only failed records
770       // results are returned in the same order as the requests in list
771       // walk the list backwards, so we can remove from list without impacting the indexes of earlier members
772       for (int i = results.length - 1; i>=0; i--) {
773         // if result is not null, it succeeded
774         if (results[i] instanceof Result) {
775           deletes.remove(i);
776         }
777       }
778     }
779   }
780 
781   /**
782    * {@inheritDoc}
783    */
784   @Override
785   public void put(final Put put) throws IOException {
786     doPut(Arrays.asList(put));
787   }
788 
789   /**
790    * {@inheritDoc}
791    */
792   @Override
793   public void put(final List<Put> puts) throws IOException {
794     doPut(puts);
795   }
796 
797   private void doPut(final List<Put> puts) throws IOException {
798     int n = 0;
799     for (Put put : puts) {
800       validatePut(put);
801       writeBuffer.add(put);
802       currentWriteBufferSize += put.heapSize();
803      
804       // we need to periodically see if the writebuffer is full instead of waiting until the end of the List
805       n++;
806       if (n % DOPUT_WB_CHECK == 0 && currentWriteBufferSize > writeBufferSize) {
807         flushCommits();
808       }
809     }
810     if (autoFlush || currentWriteBufferSize > writeBufferSize) {
811       flushCommits();
812     }
813   }
814

873   /**
874    * {@inheritDoc}
875    */
876   @Override
877   public long incrementColumnValue(final byte [] row, final byte [] family,
878       final byte [] qualifier, final long amount, final boolean writeToWAL)
879   throws IOException {
880     NullPointerException npe = null;
881     if (row == null) {
882       npe = new NullPointerException("row is null");
883     } else if (family == null) {
884       npe = new NullPointerException("column is null");
885     }
886     if (npe != null) {
887       throw new IOException(
888           "Invalid arguments to incrementColumnValue", npe);
889     }
890     return new ServerCallable<Long>(connection, tableName, row, operationTimeout) {
891           public Long call() throws IOException {
892             return server.incrementColumnValue(
893                 location.getRegionInfo().getRegionName(), row, family,
894                 qualifier, amount, writeToWAL);
895           }
896         }.withRetries();
897   }

947   /**
948    * {@inheritDoc}
949    */
950   @Override
951   public void flushCommits() throws IOException {
952     try {
953       Object[] results = new Object[writeBuffer.size()];
954       try {
955         this.connection.processBatch(writeBuffer, tableName, pool, results);
956       } catch (InterruptedException e) {
957         throw new IOException(e);
958       } finally {
959         // mutate list so that it is empty for complete success, or contains
960         // only failed records results are returned in the same order as the
961         // requests in list walk the list backwards, so we can remove from list
962         // without impacting the indexes of earlier members
963         for (int i = results.length - 1; i>=0; i--) {
964           if (results[i] instanceof Result) {
965             // successful Puts are removed from the list here.
966             writeBuffer.remove(i);
967           }
968         }
969       }
970     } finally {
971       if (clearBufferOnFail) {
972         writeBuffer.clear();
973         currentWriteBufferSize = 0;
974       } else {
975         // the write buffer was adjusted by processBatchOfPuts
976         currentWriteBufferSize = 0;
977         for (Put aPut : writeBuffer) {
978           currentWriteBufferSize += aPut.heapSize();
979         }
980       }
981     }
982   }
983 
984   /**
985    * {@inheritDoc}
986    */
987   @Override
988   public void close() throws IOException {
989     if (this.closed) {
990       return;
991     }
992     flushCommits();
993     if (cleanupPoolOnClose) {
994       this.pool.shutdown();
995     }
996     if (cleanupConnectionOnClose) {
997       if (this.connection != null) {
998         this.connection.close();
999       }
1000     }
1001     this.closed = true;
1002   }
1003 
1004   // validate for well-formedness
1005   private void validatePut(final Put put) throws IllegalArgumentException{
1006     if (put.isEmpty()) {
1007       throw new IllegalArgumentException("No columns to insert");
1008     }
1009     if (maxKeyValueSize > 0) {
1010       for (List<KeyValue> list : put.getFamilyMap().values()) {
1011         for (KeyValue kv : list) {
1012           if (kv.getLength() > maxKeyValueSize) {
1013             throw new IllegalArgumentException("KeyValue size too large");
1014           }
1015         }
1016       }
1017     }
1018   }

1058   /**
1059    * See {@link #setAutoFlush(boolean, boolean)}
1060    *
1061    * @param autoFlush
1062    *          Whether or not to enable 'auto-flush'.
1063    */
1064   public void setAutoFlush(boolean autoFlush) {
1065     setAutoFlush(autoFlush, autoFlush);
1066   }
1067 
1068   /**
1069    * Turns 'auto-flush' on or off.
1070    * <p>
1071    * When enabled (default), {@link Put} operations don't get buffered/delayed
1072    * and are immediately executed. Failed operations are not retried. This is
1073    * slower but safer.
1074    * <p>
1075    * Turning off {@link #autoFlush} means that multiple {@link Put}s will be
1076    * accepted before any RPC is actually sent to do the write operations. If the
1077    * application dies before pending writes get flushed to HBase, data will be
1078    * lost.
1079    * <p>
1080    * When you turn {@link #autoFlush} off, you should also consider the
1081    * {@link #clearBufferOnFail} option. By default, asynchronous {@link Put}
1082    * requests will be retried on failure until successful. However, this can
1083    * pollute the writeBuffer and slow down batching performance. Additionally,
1084    * you may want to issue a number of Put requests and call
1085    * {@link #flushCommits()} as a barrier. In both use cases, consider setting
1086    * clearBufferOnFail to true to erase the buffer after {@link #flushCommits()}
1087    * has been called, regardless of success.
1088    *
1089    * @param autoFlush
1090    *          Whether or not to enable 'auto-flush'.
1091    * @param clearBufferOnFail
1092    *          Whether to keep Put failures in the writeBuffer
1093    * @see #flushCommits
1094    */
1095   public void setAutoFlush(boolean autoFlush, boolean clearBufferOnFail) {
1096     this.autoFlush = autoFlush;
1097     this.clearBufferOnFail = autoFlush || clearBufferOnFail;
1098   }
1099 
1100   /**
1101    * Returns the maximum size in bytes of the write buffer for this HTable.
1102    * <p>
1103    * The default value comes from the configuration parameter
1104    * {@code hbase.client.write.buffer}.
1105    * @return The size of the write buffer in bytes.
1106    */
1107   public long getWriteBufferSize() {
1108     return writeBufferSize;
1109   }
1110 
1111   /**
1112    * Sets the size of the buffer in bytes.
1113    * <p>
1114    * If the new size is less than the current amount of data in the
1115    * write buffer, the buffer gets flushed.
1116    * @param writeBufferSize The new write buffer size, in bytes.
1117    * @throws IOException if a remote or network exception occurs.
1118    */
1119   public void setWriteBufferSize(long writeBufferSize) throws IOException {
1120     this.writeBufferSize = writeBufferSize;
1121     if(currentWriteBufferSize > writeBufferSize) {
1122       flushCommits();
1123     }
1124   }

1142   /**
1143    * Enable or disable region cache prefetch for the table. It will be
1144    * applied for the given table's all HTable instances who share the same
1145    * connection. By default, the cache prefetch is enabled.

1148    * false to disable it.
1149    * @throws IOException
1150    */

1152       final boolean enable) throws IOException {
1153     HConnectionManager.execute(new HConnectable<Void>(HBaseConfiguration
1154         .create()) {
1155       @Override
1156       public Void connect(HConnection connection) throws IOException {
1157         connection.setRegionCachePrefetch(tableName, enable);
1158         return null;
1159       }
1160     });

1227   /**
1228    * {@inheritDoc}
1229    */
1230   @Override
1231   public <T extends CoprocessorProtocol> T coprocessorProxy(
1232       Class<T> protocol, byte[] row) {
1233     return (T)Proxy.newProxyInstance(this.getClass().getClassLoader(),
1234         new Class[]{protocol},
1235         new ExecRPCInvoker(configuration,
1236             connection,
1237             protocol,
1238             tableName,
1239             row));
1240   }

1242   /**
1243    * {@inheritDoc}
1244    */
1245   @Override
1246   public <T extends CoprocessorProtocol, R> Map<byte[],R> coprocessorExec(
1247       Class<T> protocol, byte[] startKey, byte[] endKey,
1248       Batch.Call<T,R> callable)
1249       throws IOException, Throwable {
1250 
1251     final Map<byte[],R> results =  Collections.synchronizedMap(new TreeMap<byte[],R>(
1252         Bytes.BYTES_COMPARATOR));
1253     coprocessorExec(protocol, startKey, endKey, callable,
1254         new Batch.Callback<R>(){
1255       public void update(byte[] region, byte[] row, R value) {
1256         results.put(region, value);
1257       }
1258     });
1259     return results;
1260   }
1261 
1262   /**
1263    * {@inheritDoc}
1264    */
1265   @Override
1266   public <T extends CoprocessorProtocol, R> void coprocessorExec(
1267       Class<T> protocol, byte[] startKey, byte[] endKey,
1268       Batch.Call<T,R> callable, Batch.Callback<R> callback)
1269       throws IOException, Throwable {
1270 
1271     // get regions covered by the row range
1272     List<byte[]> keys = getStartKeysInRange(startKey, endKey);
1273     connection.processExecs(protocol, keys, tableName, pool, callable,
1274         callback);
1275   }
1276 
1277   private List<byte[]> getStartKeysInRange(byte[] start, byte[] end)
1278   throws IOException {
1279     Pair<byte[][],byte[][]> startEndKeys = getStartEndKeys();
1280     byte[][] startKeys = startEndKeys.getFirst();
1281     byte[][] endKeys = startEndKeys.getSecond();
1282 
1283     if (start == null) {
1284       start = HConstants.EMPTY_START_ROW;
1285     }
1286     if (end == null) {
1287       end = HConstants.EMPTY_END_ROW;
1288     }
1289 
1290     List<byte[]> rangeKeys = new ArrayList<byte[]>();
1291     for (int i=0; i<startKeys.length; i++) {
1292       if (Bytes.compareTo(start, startKeys[i]) >= 0 ) {
1293         if (Bytes.equals(endKeys[i], HConstants.EMPTY_END_ROW) ||
1294             Bytes.compareTo(start, endKeys[i]) < 0) {
1295           rangeKeys.add(start);
1296         }
1297       } else if (Bytes.equals(end, HConstants.EMPTY_END_ROW) ||
1298           Bytes.compareTo(startKeys[i], end) <= 0) {
1299         rangeKeys.add(startKeys[i]);
1300       } else {
1301         break; // past stop
1302       }
1303     }
1304 
1305     return rangeKeys;
1306   }
1307 
1308   public void setOperationTimeout(int operationTimeout) {
1309     this.operationTimeout = operationTimeout;
1310   }
1311 
1312   public int getOperationTimeout() {
1313     return operationTimeout;
1314   }
